info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 14 at 6:28PM EDT until June 14 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS Raleigh NC
info.description:
Slow moving showers and storms over northern and central Guilford county, including northern portions of Greensboro, may lead to minor flooding through mid evening.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following county, Guilford.
* WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 627 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Greensboro, McLeansville, Summerfield, Gibsonville, Stokesdale, Lake Jeanette Marina, Lake Townsend, Lake Brandt, Lake Townsend Marina, Haw River State Park, Monticello, Colfax and Belews Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING
